Get all order types for a merchant
get.description: Merchants have the ability to create custom order types via the Setup App (https://www.clover.com/setupapp). These custom order types can be associated with a System Order Type (see /v3/merchants/{mId}/system_order_types). Custom Order Types can support items in all categories (filterCategories=false) or a subset of the merchant's categories (filterCategories=true and categories property contains the list of supported categories). Note that when expanding the categories for an order type, they will only be returned if this orderType only supports a subset of the categories (filterCategories=true). If the orderType supports all categories (filterCategories=false) then you should make a GET request to /v3/merchants/{mId}/categories.

post.summary: Create or delete associations between order types and categories

parameters.name: delete
parameters.description: Setting this to `true` removes associations specified in the request body

get.summary: Return a list of system order types
get.description: Merchants can create custom Order Types via "/v3/merchants/{mId}/order_types". It is useful to associate these custom order types with particular system order types in order to group things functionally. For example, a merchant may have a "Lunch Take-Out" order type and a "Dinner Take-Out" order type. These two order types can be associated with the "TAKE-OUT-TYPE" system order type so that applications can understand that they are both take-out order types.

get.description:
Item groups allow merchants to create and manage large groups of related items. This is described to merchants as an 'Item with variants'.

For example, a merchant may sell a T-shirt that is available in various sizes and colors. Each of the T-shirt variations is an item and belongs to the T-shirt item group. Once an item group is created, it appears in Register as a single button, and tapping it brings up a choice of which variation is to be sold.

Before adding items to an item group, you first need to create the item group. Next, you create attributes (such as 'size' and 'color') and options for each attribute (such as 'small' and 'blue'). Then, you create the individual items and include the item group id to associate the items with the group. Finally, associate the options with an item.

An item can only belong to an item group if the item group id is specified when the item is created.

The name of an item which is a member of an item group is automatically generated by the Clover server as a combination of the item group name and the name of all the options associated with that item. It cannot be changed. If the item group name is changed, or if an option name is changed, then the item names will be automatically regenerated.

An item can only be a member of a single item group and once it is part of an item group it can never be removed or moved to another item group; it can only be deleted.

Similarly to how they are described by wikipedia, tags are an informal way of establishing a relationship. Tags currently may be associated with items and printers. When an tag is associated with both an item and a printer that establishes a special relationship that results in those items being printed out on the associated printer when printing an order. Other than that special case there is no effect when an item is associated with a tag. Developers may use tags to establish a relationship meaningful for their needs.

parameters.description: Filter fields: [modifiedTime, deleted, name, showInReporting, id]

This endpoint allows you to create a complete order with one request. The `OrderCart` contains most elements of an order, including line items, discounts, and tax rates. The returned Order object can be updated using other Order APIs.

For 400 Bad Request errors, the JSON response consists of two properties - `message` and `details`.

For specific cases, the `details` value is the UUID of the failed element. For example, if the server detects that an order-related element does not exist, the JSON response includes a `item_does_not_exist` message.

Sample error response with UUID: `response: {"message": "item_does_not_exist", "details": "8NR072YTBZ52W"}`

To fix this error, remove or replace the missing or invalid element from your request. For the following `message` values, the `details` value is the unrecognized UUID:
- `item_does_not_exist`
- `service_charge_does_not_exist`
- `invalid_modifier`

For the following `message` values, the `details` value is a human-readable error message:
- `cart_is_empty_or_missing`
- `bad_request`
- `order_uuid_is_null`
- `insufficient_customer_info`
- `invalid_discount_attribute` (the `details` value includes the incorrect attribute)

The response includes order cart information, order total, and taxes.

For 400 Bad Request errors, the JSON response consists of two properties - `message` and `details`.

For specific cases, the `details` value is the UUID of the failed element. For example, if the server detects that an order-related element does not exist, the JSON response includes a `item_does_not_exist` message.

Sample error response with UUID: `response: {"message": "item_does_not_exist", "details": "8NR072YTBZ52W"}`

To fix this error, remove or replace the missing or invalid element from your request. For the following `message` values, the `details` value is the unrecognized UUID:
- `item_does_not_exist`
- `service_charge_does_not_exist`
- `invalid_modifier`

For the following `message` values, the `details` value is a human-readable error message:
- `cart_is_empty_or_missing`
- `bad_request`
- `order_uuid_is_null`
- `insufficient_customer_info`
- `invalid_discount_attribute` (the `details` value includes the incorrect attribute)

get.summary: Get a list of credit refunds

get.description: Returns the status of a merchant's app billing including current subscription tier and trial status. Requires an OAuth generated token.

get.summary: Get all events for an app metered event type
get.description: Retrieves all billing events for app metered event types such as 'reservation'. Requires an OAuth generated token.See the documentation: https://docs.clover.com/clover-platform/docs/configuring-billing#section-metered-pricing

post.summary: Create an app billing metered event
post.description: Create an app billing metered event. Clover charges the merchant for each action they take on the app based on the amount specified on the app's Pricing & Distribution page.Pass "count" as a query parameter to bill the merchant for the number of metered events. "count" is ignored if you pass it in the request body.Otherwise "count" defaults to 1. Requires an OAuth generated token.See the documentation: https://docs.clover.com/clover-platform/docs/configuring-billing#section-metered-pricing

get.summary: Get an app billing metered event
get.description: Returns the event details on a merchant's app billing metered event. Requires an OAuth generated token.See the documentation: https://docs.clover.com/clover-platform/docs/configuring-billing#section-metered-pricing

delete.description: Deletes an app metered event if the event was not already billed. Requires an OAuth generated token.

price.description: DEPRECATED: Instead use per country pricing in bundleCountries

pricePerDevice.description: DEPRECATED: Instead use per country pricing in bundleCountries

bundleCountries.description: Bundle country options for this app bundle

merchant.description: The merchant that is associated with this customer

issuingState.description: State in which identification was issued

issuingCountry.description: Country in which identification was issued

invoice_number.description: Invoice number of the installment transaction

hidden.description: True if this item is hidden from Clover Register App

options.description: List of options pertaining to this item's attribute variation

code.description: Product code, e.g. UPC or EAN

price.description: Price of the item, typically in cents; use priceType and merchant currency to determine actual item price. For non-VAT merchants, this field is exclusive of tax. For VAT merchants, this field is inclusive of tax.

defaultTaxRates.description: Flag to indicate whether or not to use default tax rates

cost.description: Cost of the item to merchant, as opposed to customer price

isRevenue.description: True if this item should be counted as revenue. For example, gift cards and donations would not be counted as revenue.

itemStock.description: Item stock attribute that can be expanded to show stock quantity

deletedTime.description: Timestamp when item was last deleted

priceWithoutVat.description: The price without value-added tax (VAT). For non-VAT merchants, this field is ignored. For VAT merchants, this field is the base price of an item.

autoAcceptPaymentConfirmations.description: If set to true, confirmation requests triggered by a challenge at the payment gateway are automatically accepted, and confirmation requests are not transmitted back to the calling program. Be sure you are willing to accept the risk associated with accepting offline or duplicate payment challenges. See https://docs.clover.com/build/working-with-challenges for more information.

businessName.description: The name of the business the customer is associated with.

dobYear.description: The year part of the date of birth for this customer. This part of the date of birth is optional, i.e., it's possible that only dobMonth and dobDay are populated.

dobMonth.description: The month part of the date of birth for this customer.

dobDay.description: The day part of the date of birth for this customer.

modifiedTime.description: The timestamp from when this customer's data was last updated.

customer.description: Customer who this metadata belongs to.

type.description: The type of event that occurred

amountChange.description: The amount that was either added, removed of modified by the event

timestamp.description: Time at which the event was executed

note.description: Any additional information regarding the event

employee.description: The employee who performed the event

device.description: The device that initiated the event

merchant.description: The event occurred for this merchant.

type.description: Type of personal identification: National Document, Passport, etc

customer.description: Customer who this email address belongs to.

modifiedTime.description: The timestamp from when this card was last updated.

customer.description: Customer who this card belongs to.

country.description: The country of the app bundle country

appBundle.description: DB reference to app bundle that contains this app bundle country.

vat.description: Whether this merchant is in a VAT country

vatTaxName.description: The VAT tax name that is shown on receipts

appBillingSystem.description: Temporary while we are switching US billing systems

abaAccountNumber.description: The ABA Account Number.  Supplied by First Data.

ddaAccountNumber.description: The Masked DDA Account Number.  Supplied by First Data.

cashBackEnabled.description: Whether cash back is enabled for this merchant

cashBackOptions.description: List of cash back possible cash back amounts

maxCashBack.description: The maximum amount of cash back that the customer can select.

hierarchy.description: Merchant hierarchy (Business, Bank, Agent, Corp, Chain). Supplied by First Data.

hasConsented.description: Whether or not merchant has consented to infolease billing

merchantBoardingStatus.description: This is used to identify if the merchant is self-boarded

alwaysRequireSignature.description: Whether we always require a signature for most transactions (excluding contactless under cvm limit)

printedFirstDataReceiptLogoEnabled.description: Whether we display the First Data receipt logo

privacyPolicyMode.description: Designates the privacy policy mode for this merchant (EU_GDPR_STRICT, EU_GDPR_FLEX, US_HIPPA)

disablePrintTaxesPaymentOnReceipts.description: Whether we display the taxes table on receipts

limpModeAllowed2.description: Per the new V2 TAMPER_EXPERIENCE (see feature flag) if this is true then setting the SRED_DISABLED merchant setting to true will result in the terminal parameter DENY_COMPROMISED_TX becoming false which enables a not provisioned (tampered) device with TransArmor SRED keys to take card payments without PIN. If this is false then setting SRED_DISABLED merchant to true setting will have no effect.

nickname.description: Nickname of the employee (shows up on receipts)

inviteSent.description: Returns true if this employee was sent an invite to activate their account

claimedTime.description: Timestamp of when this employee claimed their account

deletedTime.description: Timestamp of when this employee was deleted

isOwner.description: Returns true if this employee is the owner account for this merchant

orderRef.description: The order with which the refund is associated

device.description: Device which processed the transaction for this refund, a 128-bit UUID, not a normal base-13 Clover ID.

amount.description: Total amount refunded, including tax and tip

createdTime.description: The time when the refund was recorded on the server

clientCreatedTime.description: The time when the refund was recorded on the client

payment.description: The payment with which the refund is associated

overrideMerchantTender.description: The tender type associated with this payment, e.g. credit card, cash, etc.

appTracking.description: Tracking information for the app that created this refund.

cardTransaction.description: Information about the card used for credit or debit card refunds

externalReferenceId.description: The external reference id if associated with the refund

orderRef.description: Reference to the order associated with this PrintGroup.

name.description: The print group heading that will be displayed on receipts.

sortOrder.description: The order in which this print group is displayed relative to other print groups on the same receipt. Print groups with identical sort orders will be ordered by name.

fired.description: True if this print group has been sent to an order printer.

dccApplied.description: Flag indicating whether DCC was applied on this txn

name.description: the name of the modifier when it was applied

amount.description: the additional cost of the modifier when it was applied

modifier.description: The modifier object.  Values from the Modifier are copied to the Modification at the time that the order is placed.  Modifier values may change after the modification is created.

quantitySold.description: This is only used in reports. The count of how many of these modifiers that were sold.

merchant.description: The merchant the card belongs to

employee.description: The employee who the card is currently assigned to

updater.description: The employee who last updated the card's state

number.description: Unique number on the employee card.

status.description: Current status of the employee card

createdTime.description: Timestamp of when this employee card was created

modifiedTime.description: Timestamp of when this employee card was last updated

discount.description: If this item is based on a standard discount, this will point to the appropriate inventory.Discount

approver.description: The person that authorized a discount

amount.description: Discount amount in fraction of currency unit (e.g. cents) based on currency fraction digits supported

itemGroup.description: The item group this attribute belongs to

appSubscription.description: Returns the current subscription tier of the merchant's app subscription.

isInTrial.description: Returns true if a trial period is enabled for a paid app. You can choose the number of trial period days for your app.

billable.description: Returns true if a merchant using an app is billable, and false if there is an app suppression on this particular app for the specific merchant.

appBillable.description: Returns false if all apps are non-billable for the specific merchant.

planBillable.description: Returns false if plan fees are non-billable for the specific merchant.

appExportable.description: Returns false if app charges are not exportable for the specific merchant.

planExportable.description: Returns false if plan charges are not exportable for the specific merchant.

billingStartTime.description: Returns the time when a merchant's app trial ends and billing commences.

status.description: Returns ACTIVE for an active Clover merchant when the merchant's bank account is in good standing. Returns INACTIVE if the merchant was offboarded. Returns LAPSED if the merchant failed to pay Clover for app usage. Returns SUPPRESSED if this merchant will not be billed for reasons such as it's a demo merchant account, test merchant account, or that the merchants country is a pilot.

daysLapsed.description: Returns the number of days since the merchant's account was not in the ACTIVE status.

amount.description: The cost of the subscription country

country.description: The country of the subscription country

appSubscription.description: Reference to subscription this subscription country belongs to

installCount.description: The number of merchants that have this app subscription country installed

payment.description: Payment that the auth was opened with

cardType.description: Type of credit card used for authorization

last4.description: Last 4 digits of credit card used for authorization

externalReferenceId.description: The external reference id if associated with the payment

closingPayment.description: Payment that the auth was closed with

createdTime.description: Time authorization was recorded on server

additionalCharges.description: Additional charges associated with the authorization. For incremental auth, it is the additional charge on total auth amount.

owner.description: The account that owns this merchant

printed.description: number of printed line items deleted

unprinted.description: number of unprinted line items deleted

price.description: sum of price of all the items, in cents of merchant currency.

priceWithQuantity.description: sum of price of all the items, in cents of merchant currency multiplied by quantity.

priceWithQuantityAndModifiers.description: sum of price of all the items multiplied with quantity and includes modifiers.

languageIndicator.description: 2 character language used for the transaction. Deprecated in factor of transactionLocale.

cardSymbol.description: Card Symbol for identify in payment_card_config table

terminalIdentification.description: Designates the unique location of a terminal at a merchant

externalTerminalId.description: Main internal identifier of terminal which should be the same across all Fiservs components

merchantIdentifier.description: When concatenated with the Acquirer Identifier, uniquely identifies a given merchant

merchantNameLocation.description: Indicates the name and location of the merchant

selectedService.description: Defines the Financial Service selected for the transaction

transactionTags.description: Contains a hex string with needed TLV tags for certification

txFormat.description: Contains the information how the data inside transactionTags should be coded - initially we cause default and nexo as formats

panMask.description: Contains the information how the PAN should masked.

transactionSequenceCounter.description: Counter maintained by the terminal that is incremented for each transaction at the beginning of the Perform Service function.

applicationPanSequenceNumber.description: Identifies and differentiates cards with the same PAN.

reversalReason.description: Contains the reason why the transaction should be reversed in the host. It has to be mapped in server with the expected value by the corresponding gateway

isTokenBasedTx.description: Boolean to determine if the transaction done using a vaulted card is a token based transaction

origTransactionSequenceCounter.description: For reversal and capture transactions, this contains the reference (transactionSequenceCounter) to the originating transaction.

transactionSequenceCounterUpdate.description: This field is populated when the TSC of a terminal is out of sync and is provided with an update.

emergencyFlag.description: Boolean value defining if the corresponding TX was performed in NEXO emergency mode according NEXO IS Spec chapter 10.2

entryType.description: This field contains the entry type of a transaction.

clientCardType.description:
Client card type should be used only limited purpose only and should not be confused with cardType in other objects.
 This is a read only field and must not to be overwritten on server or client once set on client. 
 This is set on client only for MSR tx for now as the AIDs are not identified for MSR. 
 For few MSR tx, the card type was identified incorrectly on client side, and also on server side based on the bin match. 
 In order to get the correct card types, this client card type will be sent to the server

explicitlySelectedApp.description: The app explicitly selected by the customer via the choice button.

isSepaElv.description: Defines if the corresponding TX was performed as SEPA ELV TX.

cardEntryType.description: Defines if the corresponding TX was performed as SEPA ELV TX.

receiptFormat.description: Value of tag E1.DF8206 from NEXO config.

extAppLabel.description: Value of tag E6.DF8211 or E6.DF8212 (Online or Offline TX printout).

preNotification.description: Value of tag E6.DF8214 info form NEXO config.

mandate.description: Value of tag E6.DF8215 info from NEXO config.

creditorId.description: Value of tag E6.DF8216 info from NEXO config.

mandateId.description: Generated by SPA according to ELV  TBD: use Trace number instead of receipt number.

iban.description: Received in ICC related data from IPG (tag 5F53).

isMerchantForced.description: Defines if the corresponding SEPA ELV TX was forced by the merchant (override defined limit)

developerAppId.description: The uuid from the developer application.  This is typically populated and used only on the back end.

applicationName.description: The name of the developer application.

applicationVersion.description: A string representing a semanticversion.  See http://semver.org/

sourceSDKVersion.description: A string representing a semanticversion.  See http://semver.org/

rate.description: Rate in percentage for this order tax rate

lineItems.description: Line item associated with this order tax rate

lineItem.description: The line item that was voided

reason.description: Why was the line item voided

approvedBy.description: Optional. Employee who approved deletion of line item in case current employee does not have the permission

deleteType.description: Indicates if the line item was deleted as part of order delete or a single item delete.

device.description: Optional. Device used to void the line item

createdBy.description: Employee who created the order from which the line item was voided

deletedTime.description: Timestamp of when this line item was deleted

environment.description: Which environment was this recorded in

clientEventType.description: What event on the client removed this? Was it because of moving a table? Or was it plain old deleting a line item?

items.description: Items that are members of this group

attributes.description: Attributes that belong to this group

customer.description: Customer who this phone number belongs to.

showInReporting.description: True if tag is a summary label in the reporting app

currency.description: Currency of this order. For example, "USD"

note.description: An arbitrary string with information about this order, may be printed on the order receipt and displayed in apps

clientCreatedTime.description: The time at which the client created this order

serviceCharge.description: Optional service charge (gratuity) applied to this order

discounts.description: Amount or percentage discounts applied to the order subtotal. To retrieve discounts applied to individual items, use the Get all line items for an order endpoint with the discounts field expanded (v3/merchants/{mId}/orders/{orderId}/line_items?expand=discounts).

lineItems.description: Line items associated with this order

groupLineItems.description: Whether similar line items should be grouped together on the receipt that this order generates. Item "similarity" is based on items having matching values for a set of properties including price, modifiers, and discounts.

name.description: Tax rate name. This field is optional.

taxableAmount.description: The sub-total of line items that the tax was based on. For VAT, this amount includes tax. For all others, this amount does not include tax.

isVat.description: Whether the taxable amount includes tax.

taxAmount.description: The amount of tax collected. In cases where there are multiple payments for an order then it may be necessary to add an extra cent of tax to the last payment.

transactionRef.description: The refund with which the tax rate is associated

amount.description: Amount of the incremental authorization, includes additional charges in db

employee.description: The employee who processed the incremental Auth

quantity.description: Current count of this item in stock.

name.description: DEPRECATED: App subscription name.  Per country pricing in subscriptionCountries.

amount.description: DEPRECATED: The cost of the subscription.  Per country pricing in subscriptionCountries.

description.description: DEPRECATED: App subscription name.  Per country pricing in subscriptionCountries.

active.description: DEPRECATED: App subscription active status.  Per country pricing in subscriptionCountries.

plan.description: True if special zero cost app pricing for default app in custom service plans.

subscriptionCountries.description: Subscription country options for this app subscription

app.description: Reference to app this subscription belongs to

id.description: Unique identifier; TBD this is confusing because it's used as either line item id or payment id

percentage.description: Percent of this line item covered by this payment

binName.description: Bin this line item payment was for

taxable.description: If this order type is taxable

isDefault.description: If this order type is the default

filterCategories.description: If set to false, then this order type includes all of the merchant's categories. Otherwise, it only contains the categories defined in the "categories" field on this object.

isHidden.description: If this order type is hidden on the register

fee.description: The price of a fee added to this order type, not fully implemented at this time.

minOrderAmount.description: The minimum amount required for an order to be placed

maxOrderAmount.description: The maximum amount for an order allowed

maxRadius.description: The maximum radius allowed for an order (i.e. delivery)

avgOrderTime.description: The average time it takes to complete the order

isDeleted.description: If this order type is deleted

systemOrderTypeId.description: Optional system order type that this order type is associated with.

hours.description: The hours this order type is available (if they differ from normal merchant hours)

categories.description: The categories of items that can be assigned to this order type

orderRef.description: The order with which the refund is associated

device.description: Device which processed the transaction for this refund, a 128-bit UUID, not a normal base-13 Clover ID.

createdTime.description: The time when the refund was recorded on the server

clientCreatedTime.description: The time when the refund was recorded on the client

credit.description: The credit with which the credit refund is associated

appTracking.description: Tracking information for the app that created this payment.

destination.description: Destination for the message CDSP - CustomerDisplay, CRCP - CustomerReceipt/AidParam, MDSP - MerchantDisplay, MRCP - MerchantReceipt/AidParam

content.description: Contains the display and/or print message text from gateway

priceWithQuantity.description: sum of price of all the items, in cents of merchant currency multiplied by quantity.

priceWithQuantityAndModifiers.description: sum of price of all the items multiplied with quantity and includes modifiers.

count.description: number of line item in this revenue class

employee.description: The employee that worked this shift

serverBanking.description: Whether the employee used server banking

overrideInEmployee.description: The employee who overrode the clock in time

overrideOutEmployee.description: The employee who overrode the clock out time

currency.description: Currency of this order. For example, "USD"

customers.description: List of customers associated with this order.

employee.description: The employee who took this order

total.description: Total price of the order in cents

externalReferenceId.description: External reference id if present in the order

unpaidBalance.description: The net of orders with payment minus the amount collected. Includes refunds, manual refunds, tax, tip, service charge, non-revenue items, paid gift card activations and loads and discounts

paymentState.description: Is this order paid or not?

note.description: An arbitrary string with information about this order, may be printed on the order receipt and displayed in apps

taxRemoved.description: If true then this order should not have taxes applied to it

isVat.description: This order was created by merchant with VAT enabled.

state.description: A String generally describing the state of the Order. When creating an Order, the value must be manually set to "open". If no value is set, the state defaults to null, which indicates an unfinished Order. An unfinished order is not displayed in user interfaces and can only be retrieved by its id. Non-null values such as "open" and "locked" are not checked or enforced by the server. Therefore, these values should not be used to make any logical decisions about the Order.

manualTransaction.description: Whether this order represents a manual transaction. A manual transaction is a transaction that has an arbitrary amount defined and is not associated with any inventory items. For example, the Clover Sale App and Clover Manual Transaction App create manual transactions. A manual transactions will have a single associated line item to hold the sale amount, but the generated receipt will display this differently to indicate that it is not considered a typical order with inventory items.

groupLineItems.description: Whether similar line items should be grouped together on the receipt that this order generates. Item "similarity" is based on items having matching values for a set of properties including price, modifiers, and discounts.

testMode.description: Whether this order was created in test mode. Payments made against test orders are not processed. Test mode orders can be deleted from the Orders App on the merchant's device or web dashboard (https://www.clover.com/orders/m/{mId}/orders). They will also be deleted when the device sends a POST to the /v2/merchant/{mId}/orders/delete_all_tests endpoint.

payType.description: Possible values: SPLIT_GUEST, SPLIT_ITEM, SPLIT_CUSTOM, FULL. During the payment flow, if the user chooses to split the payment for this order, this field will be set to one of the SPLIT_* values to indicate how the full amount should be split. If the user chooses to pay for the order in full with one payment, then this field will be FULL.

clientCreatedTime.description: The time at which the client created this order

modifiedTime.description: Last modified time of the order

serviceCharge.description: Optional service charge (gratuity) applied to this order

discounts.description: Amount or percentage discounts applied to the order subtotal. To retrieve discounts applied to individual items, use the Get all line items for an order endpoint with the discounts field expanded (v3/merchants/{mId}/orders/{orderId}/line_items?expand=discounts).

lineItems.description: Line items associated with this order

payments.description: Payments that were made for this order. If multiple payments were made, then the payType field should reflect the method used to split the total amount.

refunds.description: Refunds that were made for this order

voids.description: Voided payments associated with this order

device.description: Device which created the order, a 128-bit UUID, not a normal base-13 Clover ID.

authorizations.description: Card authorizations associated with this order

printGroups.description: Print groups for line items of this order.

orderPrefix.description: A prefix that will be applied to order numbers. This is useful if the merchant and/or customer needs to track which device an order came from.

terminalId.description: The merchant device's terminal Id. FD-IPG sets the merchant_device terminal Id for LATAM devices

imsi.description: The IMSI of the SIM in the device (if present)

simIccid.description: The ICCID of the SIM in the device (if present)

pinDisabled.description: Whether this device has PIN prompt disabled.

orderCart.description: The order cart to put items, discounts, modifications and order-related information

merchant.description: The merchant this role belongs to.

first6.description: The first four digits of the card number

last4.description: The last four digits of the card number

state.description: A state inferred from transaction type and whether the gateway captured the transaction

extra.description: Extra info to be stored as part of gateway/card transaction

vaultedCard.description: Vaulted card which can be used for subsequent transactions

gatewayTxState.description: The state as currently recorded. This differs from the legacy 'state' field. The legacy 'state' field is calculated from the 'type' field and whether the transaction was captured.

order.description: The order with which the payment is associated

device.description: Device which processed the transaction for this payment, a 128-bit UUID, not a normal base-13 Clover ID.

tender.description: The tender type associated with this payment, e.g. credit card, cash, etc.

cashbackAmount.description: Amount given back in a cash back transaction

cashTendered.description: Amount of cash given by the customer

employee.description: The employee who processed the payment

createdTime.description: Time payment was recorded on server

modifiedTime.description: Last modified time of the payment

cardTransaction.description: Information about the card used for credit/debit card payments

serviceCharge.description: Amount record as a service charge

authorization.description: Authorization which this payment is associated to (opening or closing payment) if one exists

voidPaymentRef.description: If voided, the corresponding successful payment, and vice versa

voidReason.description: If voided, the reason why (when available)

transactionSettings.description: Per transaction settings for the payment

appTracking.description: Tracking information for the app that created this payment.

cashAdvanceExtra.description: Information specific to cash advance transactions.

signatureDisclaimer.description: Information displayed to customer for storing electronic signatures

externalReferenceId.description: The external reference id if associated with the payment

name.description: Friendly name to describe the hours

rate.description: Percent rate of the additional charge times 10000

name.description: The name of the category which will appear in Clover Register App.

sortOrder.description: Integer used to determine how this category is sorted against other categories.

items.description: Ordered list of items associated with this category.

deleted.description: Whether the category has been deleted.

modifiedTime.description: The time this category was last modified

minRequired.description: The minimum amount of modifiers from this group that must be applied to associated lineItems when using Register

maxAllowed.description: The maximum amount of modifiers from this group that can be applied to associated lineItems when using Register

showByDefault.description: Whether employees will be automatically prompted to add modifiers from this category when using Register

modifierIds.description: An ordered, comma-separated list of modifier ids in this group. (READ ONLY)

sortOrder.description: The ordinal value used to determine where in an ordered list this modifier group should appear relative to others.

enabled.description: If this service charge is enabled

percentageDecimal.description: Percent to charge times 10000, e.g. 12.5% will be 125000

orderRef.description: The order with which the credit is associated

device.description: Device which processed this credit, a 128-bit UUID, not a normal base-13 Clover ID.

tender.description: The tender type associated with this payment, e.g. credit card, cash, etc.

employee.description: The employee who processed the payment

createdTime.description: Time payment was recorded on server

cardTransaction.description: Information about the card used for credit/debit card payments

transactionSettings.description: Per transaction settings for the payment

appTracking.description: Tracking information for the app that created this credit.

externalReferenceId.description: The external reference id if associated with the credit

supportsPreauthOverage.description: If true the gateway will allow an amount greater than the preauth amount to be captured.

production.description: Field to identify whether the payment processor is real or demo. 'true' is returned for real payment processsor. 'false' is returned for demo payment processor.

rate.description: For percentage based discounts like sales tax

items.description: Items associated with this tax rate

taxAmount.description: For a flat tax like recycling redemption fee, expressed as number of cents

deletedTime.description: Timestamp when tax rate was last deleted

modifiedTime.description: Timestamp when tax rate was last modified

disclaimerValues.description: Values that will be substituted in standard disclaimer text (txn date/time, account number, product label, etc.

app.description: The app the notification will be sent to. This will be autopopulated by the server.

timeToLive.description: The time to live of the notification in seconds. By default this is 5 days.

data.description: Payload of the notification. This is at most 4000 characters.

hasModifiers.description: flag to indicate if any line item has modifiers

chartTotals.description: totals of all the chart data

orderCart.description: The order cart to put items, discounts, modifications and order-related information

amount.description: DEPRECATED: App metered amount. Instead use per country pricing in meteredCountries

action.description: DEPRECATED: App metered action. Instead use per country pricing in meteredCountries

active.description: DEPRECATED: App metered active status. Instead use per country pricing in meteredCountries

meteredCountries.description: Metered country options for this app metered

app.description: Reference to the app this metered belongs to

label.description: A label used to identify this metered action

amount.description: The cost of the metered country

country.description: The country of the metered country

appMetered.description: Reference to metered this metered country belongs to

locales.description: List of locale specific metered country resources.

orderCart.description: The order cart to put items, discounts, modifications and order-related information

total.description: Total price of the order in cents

subtotal.description: Subtotal price of the order in cents

totalTaxAmount.description: Amount of the total tax of the order in cents

isVat.description: If checkout by merchant with VAT enabled

item.description: A reference to the inventory item that was used to create this line item. Note that since this a reference the item can be changed and deleted any time such that it no longer matches this line item.

alternateName.description: Alternate name of the line item.

price.description: Price of the item, typically in cents of merchant currency. When unit quantity is not null then this is the price for a single unit and is not the complete price.

priceWithModifiers.description: Price of item after adding all modifications. This is used only for reporting.

priceWithModifiersAndItemAndOrderDiscoun.description: Price of item after adding all modifications and subtracting all line item and order level discounts. This is used only for reporting.

unitQty.description: Unit quantity if this line item is priced by quantity, or null if the item is not priced by quantity. The value is a fixed-point integer with scaling factor of 1000 (e.g. if charging by ounces then the value should be set to 2500 for 2.5 ounces). To compute the complete price perform the following calculation: PRICE * (UNIT QTY / 1000).

unitName.description: Unit name (e.g. oz, lb, etc) if priced by unit, otherwise null.

printed.description: True if this line item has been printed out on an order printer at least once already.

discounts.description: List of discounts applied to the line item. Each line item on an order may have zero or more percentage or amount discounts. Line item discounts are separate from order-level discounts (which are applied to the order subtotal).

orderLevelDiscounts.description: List of order level discounts attributed to this line item. Amounts are rounded to the nearest penny. This is for reporting purposes only. These rounding approximates are not used when calculating the transaction.

discountAmount.description: Unnamed fixed discount amount in cents. Or, in reporting, this may be the calculated sum of all the line item discounts.

orderLevelDiscountAmount.description: The calculated sum of order level discounts attributed, approximately to the nearest cent, to this the line item. This is only used in reporting.

modifications.description: List of references to modifications applied to this line item.

tags.description: List of tags associated with this line item.

refunded.description: True if this line item has been refunded

isRevenue.description: True if this item should be counted as revenue, for example gift cards and donations would not.

taxRates.description: Tax rates that apply to this line item

payments.description: Payments that apply to this line item

revenueAmount.description: Revenue collected for this. This field is only used in reporting.

quantitySold.description: Quantity sold for this line item. This field is only used in reporting

printGroup.description: Optional reference to the print group that this line item belongs to.

editable.description: If this merchant tender is editable

opensCashDrawer.description: If this tender opens the cash drawer

supportsTipping.description: Allow tipping on payment from tender

enabled.description: If this merchant tender is enabled

visible.description: If this merchant tender is visible

name.description: Tax rate name. This field is optional.

isDefault.description: Whether the tax rate was configued as a default tax rate at the time that the payment was created.

taxableAmount.description: The sub-total of line items that the tax was based on. For VAT, this amount includes tax. For all others, this amount does not include tax.

isVat.description: Whether merchant is configured as VAT

taxAmount.description: The amount of tax collected. In cases where there are multiple payments for an order then it may be necessary to add an extra cent of tax to the last payment.

cardbrand_original_transaction_id.description: The transaction id received from schemes for the initial transaction required if sequence is SUBSEQUENT. Note: Mastercard transactions do not use this field for Subsequent transactions.

sequence.description: Whether the transaction is the FIRST or SUBSEQUENT for the same payment card.Valid Note: Mastercard transactions only support SUBSEQUENT transactions for stored credentials feature

is_scheduled.description: Whether transaction is scheduled or part of an installment

initiator.description: Whether it's MERCHANT initiated or explicitly consented by CARDHOLDER.

merchant.description: The merchant the tax rule belongs to

orderType.description: Order Type which to apply the tax rule

rates.description: Tax rates associated with this rule

createdTime.description: Timestamp when the tax rule was created

modifiedTime.description: Timestamp when the tax rule was last modified

deletedTime.description: Timestamp when tax rule was last deleted

orderRef.description: Reference to the order to be printed

deviceRef.description: The printing device. A 128-bit UUID, not a normal base-13 Clover ID.

createdTime.description: Timestamp when the print event was created

modifiedTime.description: Timestamp when the print event was last modified

deletedTime.description: Timestamp when the print event was last deleted

printTime.description: Timestamp when the print event needs to fire to printer

name.description: The name of the merchant plan

trialDays.description: Transient field, the free trial period, as defined in this plan's group.

trialExpirationTime.description: Date/time this plan's trial will expire for the merchant with this plan. This is a transient value only applicable to the merchant assigned to this plan.

defaultPlan.description: If true and multiple plans of this code then treat as default plan for reseller. Cannot use word default.

recommended.description: True if plan metadata indicates this plan should be recommended in OOBE plan selection.

bogo.description: If true then plan offers by one device get one free.

weight.description: Represents the importance or value the planCode has. Helpful for determining when a merchant is downgrading or upgrading their plan

items.description: List of LineItem objects to create
